title: Second Copy 8.0.5.3 Portable by speedzodiac
description:
Second Copy 8.0.5.3 Portable

Second CopyÃƒâ€šÃ‚Â® is the perfect backup product designed for all versions of Windows, including 9x/Me/NT4/2000/XP/2003/Vista, you have been looking for. It makes a backup of your data files to another directory, disk or computer across the network. It then monitors the source files and keeps the backup updated with new or changed files. It runs in the background with no user interaction. So, once it is set up you always have a backup of your data somewhere else.

Major features in Second Copy:

Program Options:

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Password protect profiles
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Organize profiles in groups
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Limit the log to only errors and summaries
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Copy files locally, to a network drive, external drive, optical or zip disk
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Copy files using FTP to or from a remote computer
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Restore files back to the source location with ease
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Encrypt files during copy

Copy Options:

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Detect file deletions during synchronization
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Copy files based on the archive bit instead of time stamp
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Span copies across multiple disks
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Ignore files older than or newer than a certain date or number of days
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Select directories in a graphical tree view
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Skip profiles based on Windows Hardware profiles
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Auto log-in to remote system with Dial-up networking
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Run a program before and after running the profile

Scheduling Options :

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Skip profile on designated days of the week
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· View scheduling options more conveniently
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Easily toggle profiles between periodic and manual schedule
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Run profiles at shut down without the Windows 20-second time limit
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Run profiles when the source files on the local hard disk change

Compression Library :

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Set compression ratio for Zip files
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Use built-in Zip viewer to view, compress and extract any Zip files
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Supports PKWare's latest industry standard PKZip v4.5 zip file format as well as the traditional PKZip v2.04g format
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· No limitations on Zip file size and the number of files in a zip file

User Interface:

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Tip of the day
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Hide icon
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Show balloon hints
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Internet update to the software versions
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Quicker editing of custom profiles
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Show source and destination in details view
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Display Progress bar
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â· Display Preview of the profile activity before running

OS : Win XP/2000/Vista/Win 7
Language : English

*** When using TPB please read these important notes: 
-----------------------------------------------------

01. AV software may warn about keygens, patches, cracks etc because of their 
    capabilities and signatures (generating codes, etc). Sometimes also they're 
    added to the virus/spyware database and will be detected as malware. If not 
    trusting keygens, patches, cracks etc don't use them.

02. To avoid AV software removing/blocking clean cracks etc: exclude the crack 
    or folder from being auto-protected & auto-scanned by the AV software.

03. If AV software removed a clean crack usually it can be restored 
    (if it's not in Quarantine then look at History or something similar).

04. To avoid risks when using cracks also Sandboxie can be used to test them:
   <a href=" http://www.sandboxie.com/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.sandboxie.com/</a>
   <a href=" http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6487418" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://thepiratebay.se/torrent/6487418</a>

05. Before running .exe-files, keygens, patches, cracks etc always check first 
    if they can be unpacked. Often some thirth party added a virus to the 
    original file, repacked it, and uploaded it again.

06. Letting AV software software sending scan results to their companies 
    can cause keygens, patches, cracks etc being added to their virus-database.

07. Firewalls which are set to automatically decide for connections will allow 
    connections for lots of apps & MALWARE!. To avoid so firewalls should be set 
    to decide yourself which connection to allow or not.

08. Clicking on unknown links can coz malware being silently installed on a pc!

09. Usually (new) torrents with extreme many downloads & seeders in a short time 
    are very suspicious! Torrents with a SKULL-logo are trusted.

10. Some (frustrated) people use multiple accounts and post lots of FAKE comments 
    and/or files trying to spread confusion. Usually they NEVER seriously reply 
    on comments and don't have any torrent, or to look reliable just a few.

11. In general often there are more fake & negative comments than reliable & 
    positive comments.

12. In some countries uploading/downloading copyright-protected material is 
    forbidden, but showing some appreciation to reliable uploaders is not.

13. Posting FAKE comments & uploads on TPB can result in getting banned from TPB!

14. Comments are welcome, unlike ranting, trolling, whining, etc.

15. No Promises ... No Debts!
